intro: Codonoboea ascendens, commonly known as the climbing codonanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its trailing or climbing growth habit. The plant features heart-shaped, glossy leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of red, orange, or yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its natural range.
